issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: client
components.description: Code for submitting and monitoring jobs

fields.description:
hadoop jar myjar.jar MyDriver -fs file:/// -jt local input.txt output/
should run a job using the local file system and the local job runner. Instead it tries to connect to a jobtracker.

hadoop jar myjar.jar MyDriver -fs file:/// -jt host:port input.txt output/
does not use the given host/port

This appears to be because Cluster#initialize, which loads the ClientProtocol, contains no special handling for mapred.job.tracker.
fields.summary: -jt generic command line option does not work

comments.body: On closer examination, Cluster#initialize doesn't need any special handling, mapreduce.framework.name should be set to local.
Updated patch to not set the number of local mappers to 1.  Verified via command line that it works both with local and remote.

LGTM, but I think we should deprecate -jt in favor or -rm. Sandy, mind starting a thread in common-dev about it? Based on the outcome we commit this patch or we udpate it to support -rm and deprecate -jt.

{color:red}-1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12568676/MAPREDUCE-4994-1.patch
  against trunk revision .

    {color:green}+1 @author{color}.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    {color:red}-1 tests included{color}.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    {color:green}+1 javac{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    {color:green}+1 javadoc{color}.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    {color:green}+1 eclipse:eclipse{color}.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    {color:green}+1 findbugs{color}.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    {color:green}+1 release audit{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    {color:green}+1 core tests{color}.  The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-common.

    {color:green}+1 contrib tests{color}.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/3321//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/3321//console

This message is automatically generated.
It makes sense to remove -jt as there is no notion of jobtracker anywhere in 2.x

Also, is there any reason to make the hadoop command-line be YARN and resourcemanager-aware? Ignoring what was supported in earlier versions, for the future, would it more preferable to have the local runner option be part of say a mapred command line option?

Hitesh, you have a point. Still, we have to figure out a meaningful convenience option, something like '-framework' that could be used doing  '-framework local' or '-framework yarn=HOST:PORT'. I say convenience because all these options can always be specified as -Dkey=value if you set all then necessary properties. But I'd say solving this is a complete different JIRA.

This JIRA is is to fix a backwards compatibility issue. Unless there are objection, I'll commit this tomorrow afternoon PST.
Thanks Sandy. committed to trunk and branch-2.

* /hadoop/common/trunk/hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/mapred/LocalClientProtocolProvider.java

This change broke a number of unit tests in hadoop-mapreduce-client-jobclient, namely:

* TestChainMapReduce
* TestLineRecordReader
* TestClientProtocolProviderImpls

Sorry about that.  It looks like TestChainMapReduce and TestLineRecordReader were broken by no longer setting all local jobs to have one mapper.  TestClientProtocolProviderImpls was using the the mapreduce.jobtracker.address config that the patch took out.

Uploading an addendum patch that fixes these.
Mmhh, wouldn't be better to get 1 MAP as default if not set?
